author: Thomas Bristow
title: Pep Guardiola urges for more support from Man City fans in strained post-match press conference
text:
Pep Guardiola has cried for more support from Manchester City fans. 
The Spaniard made the claim in his post-match press conference following his side's 2-1 win over Burnley. 
After half-an-hour inside the Eithad, City were goalless and down to ten men - and the fans were starting to voice their frustration. 
Following the half-time interval, Guardiola attempted to raise the crowd's spirits as he walked back to the dugout by repeatedly raising his arms. 
The City boss was asked after the game why he thought the need to do this. Pep Guardiola cut a frustrated figure (Photo: Reuters) 
"We need their support, the players deserve their support," he said. 
"We are going to try and play as best as possible but we need their support." Pep Guardiola failed to hide his frustration (Photo: Reuters) 
Asked if he felt he wasn't getting enough in the first half, the Manchester City boss simply responded "no". Guardiola added that he just wanted "more".
